summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, dated November 28, 2021, regarding the upcoming trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. It expresses the prosecutor's resolve to pursue justice for historical sex crimes, announces the trial's commencement details including courtroom locations and timing, and calls for support as victims are expected to testify.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell'. The email states she sexually exploited underage girls and caused harm to vulnerable kids.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The author of the email, a federal prosecutor from the Southern District of New York, who is preparing for the trial's opening and encouraging colleagues to attend.

events.title: Start of Ghislaine Maxwell Trial
events.description: The trial of Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to begin with peremptory challenges, preliminary instructions, and opening statements.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The prosecutor asserts that the Southern District of New York is willing to prosecute sex crimes from as far back as 1994, contrasting with implied reluctance elsewhere.
The core allegation is that Ghislaine Maxwell sexually exploited underage girls and caused unspeakable harm to vulnerable children.
Brave women (victims) are expected to take the witness stand during the trial.
The trial's opening proceedings are detailed, including specific courtroom numbers and a start time of 8:30 a.m. for jury selection and openings.
The document is a motivational and logistical email from the prosecution team on the eve of a high-profile trial.
